did.physdesc: Correspondence, notes, receipts (acknowledgments), time books, records (documents) .
did.abstract: Records include correspondence and memoranda, 1854-1889, concerning contracts, construction and purchases; also letters from English operatives re the conditions of their employment at Pacific Mills, 1862-1866; orders for English machinery by William C. Chapin, Agt., 1862; tax bills & receipts; construction memorandum, 1873. Also includes one spinning time book, 1879-1881; name in flyleaf, "Mr. John Barker, W Spinning, Pacific Mills, Lawrence." Also assignment of patent rights, 1876, from Samuel Barlow for an invention for improvement in manufacturing ornamental textile fabrics, and expense account of Joseph Walworth, 1863.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Pacific Mills, located in Lawrence, Mass., were textile printers, dyers and bleachers and manufactured cotton and worsted goods.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and memoranda concerning contracts, construction and purchases, 1854-1889; bills and receipts for supplies, personnel, etc., many with the name of William C. Chapin, who served as mill agent; expense account of Joseph Walworth, 1863; and assignment of patent rights, March 27, 1876, from Samuel Barlow of Lawrence for an invention for improvement in the art of manufacturing ornamental textile fabrics. Also includes a spinning time book, 1879-1881, with the name, John Barker, in flyleaf; correspondence from English operatives stating conditions of their agreement to work as weavers, a color maker, a bleacher, etc., 1862-1866; and orders for English machinery, 1862.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: American Textile History Museum Collection, gift of Ray Hooper and the Lawrence Public Library.
